caption:
This photograph depicts a middle-aged man seated on a large bed covered with a multi-colored striped blanket, primarily in shades of blue and green. The man is casually dressed in a dark blue jacket, blue jeans, and is barefoot. He's focused on reading a newspaper and holding a cup, possibly containing a beverage like coffee or tea.

The room has plain white walls, and above the bed, there is a distinctive wall decoration made of various colorful tin cans arranged in a grid-like pattern. Next to the bed, on a small brown bedside cabinet, are a few small items that appear to be decorative figurines. Overall, the setting gives an impression of a comfortable, lived-in space, with a unique personal touch provided by the wall art made from tin cans. The lighting is soft, suggesting the photo may have been taken in natural daylight.
title: Lawyer Steve Natelson, who lives near Taos, New Mexico, relaxes on the bed of his experimental home built of empty steel beer and soft drink cans.
